intro: Anthospermum hispidulum, commonly known as the hairy anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
